block.p: Nancy Lynne Harrison, a daughter of Shelley and Gilbert Harrison of New York, was married last evening at her parents' house in Southampton, N.Y., to Michael Eric Lascher, a son of Sheila Bordo Silver of Newburgh, N.Y., and the late Gerald B. Lascher. Cantor William Satzman officiated.
Mr. and Mrs. Lascher, both 26, graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, the bride cum laude.

Nancy Lynne Harrison, a daughter of Shelley and Gilbert Harrison of New York, was married last evening at her parents' house in Southampton, N.Y., to Michael Eric Lascher, a son of Sheila Bordo Silver of Newburgh, N.Y., and the late Gerald B. Lascher. Cantor William Satzman officiated.
Mr. and Mrs. Lascher, both 26, graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, the bride cum laude.

Until May, the bride was a financial analyst for the Ralph Lauren Home Collection in New York. In September she is to begin studying for an M.B.A. degree at Columbia University. Her father is the chairman of Financo, an investment bank in New York.

The bridegroom, who received a law degree from Yeshiva University, is an associate in the real estate group at the New York law firm of Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft. His mother owns Lascher Realty Management in Newburgh. His father was a partner in Lascher & Lascher, a former law firm in Newburgh. The bridegroom's stepfather, Barry Silver, is a partner in Silver, Forrester, Schisano & Lesser, a law firm in New Windsor, N.Y.
